moderator_response.Reason: The aggressive side has been consistently making moves that put pressure on the positional side and have successfully gained control of the center of the board. Their latest move, 60...Kc6, continues this trend by attacking the positional side's pawn structure and potentially opening up the position for their pieces to attack. The positional side has been on the defensive for most of the game and has not been able to mount a strong counterattack.
